ComputationMethod: Number of productions of major commodities including copra and cocoa
Concept: There are three level of production, Primary which is more concern with the extraction of raw materials from the earth’s surface for instance farming and fishing. Secondary, this is made up of manufacturing or processing and construction. Lastly tertiary, made up of services used to aid the other two levels of production.
Definition: Level of production refers to the amount that is produced. It is a way of classifying production. The amount that is produced or the level of operation of production of a country is affected by the resources available and the extent to which a country is able to exploit the resources available
Rationale: To identify the country’s main level of production with the level of available resources it has.
graph_title: Level of production of major commodities to include cocoa and copra
